name: EDUC 151B
title: Community Literacies Field Study
description: Field study for Corre la Voz interns. Intensive on-site training and participation in team teaching of dual-language  (Spanish English) students (4th-5th grade). Literacies include social-emotional, expressive (artistic/dramatic), collaborative problem-solving, academic, and use of digital tools as well as traditional tools. Enrollment by interview only, and successful application to the Corre la Voz program. Concurrent enrollment in OAKS 151A is required during the first quarter after which OAKS 151B may be repeated by itself. May be repeated for credit.
class_notes: 151B Field Study Prep and Site Work: Weds on campus 7:10-8:10; School site T/Th 3-5:30 To participate in this course, students must be fingerprinted by District (no cost) no later than Jan. 3 for Winter Quarter. To be fingerprinted, students must have negative TB test results in hand and must already be enrolled. For information and enrollment add-codes, e-mail instructor: Leslie Lopez,lesliel@ucsc.edu
